Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2018 03:40PM alwaysbepositive wrote: Hi, don't want to scare anyone, even though fear is just part of this journey, but I had only 1 micro met when they did my mx. So BS was happy, but sent me MO because I had 3 tumors in left breast. After all my initial testing and scans at onc office, it showed that mine didn't go through my nodes, but via the bloodstream and was already in several bones. So, my advice would be to do chemo to knock out any chance of trace cells. I found chemo was yucky with lots of SE's, but manageable. It's only for a few months and you can look back and say "I did it, its over". And maybe enjoy life with a little more peace of mind Just my take on things, but we are all different and handle this road differently. And that's ok. Take care, Jenny
Posts.Title: Micromets in node - chemo or no? Staceybee Margot62

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2018 06:51PM alwaysbepositive wrote: May 2017 first dx, not really staged June 2017 left mast July 2017 bone mets after PET Aug 2017 started treat

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2018 09:31PM alwaysbepositive wrote: I haven't been actually dx with them, but my scans show a nodule on mine with metabolic activity of 4.5 SUV. So my onc is watching it to see if it grows. My next PET is in June. I had my last chemo in Dec, now I'm on targeted and endocrine therapies

Posts.Title: Anyone diagnosed with adrenal gland mets? duchessoftea Stilts

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2018 09:13AM alwaysbepositive wrote: I was 37, last year. Had a leaky nipple for 6 mos, went to OB/Gyn and they did a mammo. It showed nothing, but she sent me to breast specialist and they did an ultrasound which showed a mass, biopsy came back as DCIS, then had breast MRI which showed 4 tumors total in left breast. We did mast, path came back as IDC, then met MO and had all the scans, which showed it was already in 3 places in my bones. Started treatments in Aug 2017.
